metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9862 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer signedness error in bspatch.c in bspatch in bsdiff, as used in Apple OS X before 10.11.6 and other products, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) via a crafted patch file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdiff - 4.3-17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bsdiff package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3-17').
